name: BC Open Location  Services Geocoder

It also provides additional capability, such as correcting and standardizing civic and non civic addresses, reverse geocoding addresses within areas of interest, locating intersections and identifying parcels associated with specific addresses. https://github.com/bcgov-dss/loc-tools/blob/main/ocp-namespace-docs/988040-namespace.md

This application will replace the current reporting process which is largely done in Excel.

There is also a back end portal for Gov staff to log receipt of the NCQ and take ownership.

name: Forest Operations Map

Subsequent to Bill 21, new requirements in the Forest Planning and Practices Regulation (FPPR) to produce a Forest Operations Map (FOM) will come into force. In order to ensure compliance with new legislation and associated regulations, an online application to host FOM data is required.

Exchange of verifiable credentials and digital proofs of those VCs is possible via a secure connection established between each BPA instance.  This component also enable peer to peer notifications, and features for publishing a public profile.

name: CSB eDivorce application

description: The Security Programs Division Electronic Criminal Records Check allows applicants to apply for an eCRC through an online portal using their BC Services Card.

name: Electronic Site Registry Application
description: The province of British Columbia has a statutory requirement to make contaminated site information available to the public.  This is currently served by a mainframe app hosted on BC  Online.  That application will be redeveloped and deployed here

name: FOI Modernization

name: BC Open Location  Services Route Planner
description: The BC Route Planner is a REST web service that offers vehicle route plans that are based on the BC Digital Road Atlas. The BC Route Planner computes the shortest or fastest route between start and end points and returns the route, distance, time, and directions. The Route Planner can be used by any B.C. Government application. https://github.com/bcgov-dss/loc-tools/blob/main/ocp-namespace-docs/1475a9-namespace.md

It aims to be the most comprehensive, reliable and accessible data management system for clean transportation in the world.

name: HNI Modernization Project

name: WHIS

Wildlife Health Program, which aims to improve our understanding of factors affecting wild animal health in Britisih Columbia. The data housed in this system will be used to explore the effects of diseases and parasites upon animal populations over time, and to show how such changes relate to changes in the environment.

name: WALLY

Geomark is used to mark geographic extent of the proposed activity on a map via polygon shapes. Major clients are FLNROD, FrontCounter BC, eReferral.

name: Water Notations Data Pipeline

A cronjob will exist that will pull stream notation data from the BC geographic warehouse, load it to the database run an analysis and then copy the results of the data to object storage.

name: WRF
description: Weather Research Forecasting (WRF) is a simple geographic front end to meteorological data that is being maintained in object storage.  The app will use a leaflet based web map with a grid of the various meteorological cells, the user will, click on the map, select a bounding box size and date range.  The app will then bundle up the requested data and provide to the user.

Project make use of OCP for CI and CD aspects for application deployment.

Targeting February 26 for migration completion.

description: The Human Rights Tribunal (HRT) system is one many applications being developed under the Tribunal Transformation Initiative (TTI) project. Intake forms to allow users to submit a complaint to the Human Rights Tribunal. Form data is passed to the case management system built in Salesforce.

name: EMBC OnLine Expense Authorization Forms
description: Emergency Management BC (EMBC) OnLine Expense Authorization Forms (EAFs) provide a front end  form for integration with the EMBC ETeams application.

name: CSB Court of Appeal
description:
Courts Services Branch Court of Appeal is an interactive online application to walk a user through plain language questions to apply for appeals.

(OCP3 Migration)

name: RSBC Digital Forms Back End
description: Road Safety BC (RSBC) Digital Forms is an online forms application for review and dispute processes for citizen facing forms such as Immediate Roadside Prohibitions (IRP), ADP and Unlicensed Driver impounds. The backend API components work in unison with the front end forms to create a cohesive solution for RSBC

name: Superior Courts Judiciary Online Booking
description: Superior Courts Judiciary Online Booking allows external users to access information from the Superior Courts so that they can book a particular hearing using the online website. For the Supreme Court, the bookings are related to conference hearings such that the process minimizes the current wait times for standard phone bookings. For the Court of Appeal, the bookings will be related to the booking of a hearing of appeal.

name: PSD Community Safety Act Application
description: Police Services Division Community Safety Act application portal component for a cases management system to manage compliance and enforcement of the Community Safety Act.

name: BioHub
description:
BioHub will be the platform for hosting of the British Columbia's species inventory and habitat for internal and external stakeholders. The platform will also provide common services like taxonomy information, code management, data security, data sharing agreements admin, user and user group management and advanced searching capabilities.

The 4 current projects will be using the platform for data exchange, taxonomy, codes, data analysis, data security and data sharing agreements.

name: HybridWorkPlace
description: A cutting edge web site to foster aspiring leaders and continuous learning

name: CCBC Metabase
description: A namespace for our cutting edge open source data analytics tool, so that it can be used across applications in the cluster.

name: Habitat restoration Tracker
description: Restoration Tracker is a system which supports the planning, implementation and monitoring of restoration projects in British Columbia. The initial release (March 2022) collects project and treatment details for caribou herd restoration initiatives in the north east of the province. Future development will support all restoration projects within the province and will assist with planning and monitoring the effectiveness of these projects.

name: Modern Engagement Tools
description: A common component for public engagement starting with EAO, EMLI and GDX.

name: FINtranet

description: The BC Corrections StaffNet application allows BC Corrections to maintain employee roles with the CORNET application, print ID cards, and is being extended to allow enrolment of staff biometrics into the on premise Electronic Security and Control System which provides surveillance, communication, and door control to secure the custody centres.  This integration provides access to data sources to support this application via the implementation of several APIs.

name: CSB CEIS CRDP Integration
description: The business goal of the CEIS-CRDP integration is to enable BC-registered divorces to be certified Federally. The general solution approach is enable the CEIS application to publish BC-registered divorces to the CRDP application. The technical approach is to exchange files between CEIS (JAG) and CRDP (DOJ) via the Managed Secure File Transfer (MSFT) service operated by SharedServices Canada (SSC).

description: New Cloud Security Schedule with logic and plain language to make completing the schedule simpler based on user context.

As this is a LAB space for the sector we will potentially connect or consume a variety of services over time.

description: The Court Services Branch (CSB) Courts Fees and Fines management system (CFFMS) hosts services that enable the broader CFFMS application functionality. This consists of APIs, Adapters and other services that work with the core MS Dynamics Finance and Operations backend hosted by AG/PSSG ISB.

An application for the review and redaction of FOI records.

We are early adopters of Emerald where this app will ultimately reside. However, as we cannot onboard onto Emerald until November, we would like to provision a Silver Cluster namespace for now so our development is not blocked. 

We will migrate to Emerald when it is available.

name: Soil Relocation Information System
description: Soil Relocation Information System manages soil relocation notifications and high volume receiving site registration and  gives access to Indigenous Nations, municipalities, and other interested parties to access information on soil relocation through a mapping application.  Interested parties can subscribe to be automatically notified of soil relocation or high volume receiving site registrations in their area(s).

name: BC Laws
description: BC Laws provides access for citizens and ministries to view, search, print, all Laws, Acts, Regulations, Gazette publications and more. The platform also provides an API that specifies how to search and retrieve from the library's collection in either form: website or XML. BC Laws is published by the King's Printer for British Columbia in partnership with the Ministry of Attorney General and Legislative Assembly.

name: Hydrometric Rating Curve
description: A hydrometric rating curve describes the mathematical relationship between stage and discharge. The rating curve app allows users to upload any stage and discharge datasets, develop and optimize rating models as well as save and compare results from previous sessions.
